title: US Social Determinants of Health (2014)
description: To quantify social determinants of health (SDOH) as multiple dimensions across the continental United States (the 48 contiguous states and the District of Columbia) to examine the association of SDOH with premature mortality within Chicago, Illinois, fifteen variables, measured as a 5-year mean, were selected to characterize SDOH as small-area variations for demographic characteristics of vulnerable groups, economic status, social and neighborhood characteristics, and housing and transportation availability at the census-tract level. This SDOH data matrix was reduced to 4 indices reflecting advantage, isolation, opportunity, and mixed immigrant cohesion and accessibility, which were then clustered into 7 distinct multidimensional neighborhood typologies. The association between SDOH indices and premature mortality (defined as death before age 75 years) in Chicago was measured by years of potential life lost and aggregated to a 5-year mean. Data analyses were conducted between July 1, 2018, and August 30, 2019. The variables are derived from the 2014 American Community Survey 5-year mean. These sample data are referenced in the tutorials for GeoDa, GeoDaSpace, and CAST.
creator: Kolak, Marynia, Bhatt, Jay, Park, Yoon Hong, Padron, Norma, and Molefe, Ayrin. "Quantification of Neighborhood-Level Social Determinants of Health in the Continental United States." JAMA Network Open. 2020;3(1):e1919928. doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2019.19928
publisher: GeoDa Data and Lab, Center for Spatial Data Science, University of Chicago
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
subject: Demographics
Economic Stability
Employment
Education
Health and Healthcare
Housing
Neighborhood and Built Environment
Social and Community Context
Transportation and Infrastructure
spatial_resolution_note: Tracts outside of the continental United States, without population numbers in 2014, and/or with incomplete data, were not included in the analysis.
methods_variables: Percentage of persons below poverty estimate
Percentage of civilian (age 16+) unemployed estimate
Per capita income estimate
Percentage of persons with no high school diploma (age 25+) estimate
Percentage of single parent households with children under 18 estimate
Percentage of persons (age 5+) who speak English “less than well” estimate
Percentage of households with more people than rooms estimate
Percentage of households with no vehicle available estimate
Percentage of renters estimate
Percentage of renters paying over 30% of income towards housing estimate
Percentage of uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate
Percentage minority (all persons except white, non-Hispanic) estimate
Percentage of persons aged 65 and older estimate
Percentage of persons aged 17 and younger estimate
Percentage of civilian noninstitutionalized population with a disability estimate
1_SES - Socioeconomic Advantage Index, raw
2_MOB - Limited Mobility Index, raw
3_URB - Urban Core Opportunity Index, raw
4_MICA - MICA Index, raw
SDOH_CL - 1:rural affordable, 2:suburban affluent, 3:suburban affordable, 4:extreme poverty, 5:multilingual working, 6:urban core opportunity, 7:sparse areas
